ai.summary: Carsaig Arches Trail is a 6.4 km moderate coastal hike featuring dramatic basalt arches, sea views, and rugged shorelines. The route combines rocky paths, grassy sections, and gentle ascents, suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal path with uneven, rocky footing, short steep sections, exposed cliff edges, mud in wet weather, and some steps near arches. Weather can be windy and spray from the sea may affect footing.
ai.safety_notes: Watch for loose rocks and keep away from cliff edges; be mindful of tides and wave spray; wear sturdy boots and weather-appropriate clothing; carry a map or GPS and a charged phone; inform someone of your planned route and return time; turn back if conditions deteriorate.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Extra layers and a warm hat/gloves
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight (in case you’re out after dark)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September) generally offers the best hiking conditions in the UK; be prepared for changing weather in any season.

seo.title: Carsaig Arches Trail — 6.4 km Moderate Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Carsaig Arches Trail: a 6.4 km moderate coastal hike with dramatic cliffs and natural arches. Learn routes, safety tips, and essential gear for UK hikers.
